quoteFirst: Friday, 24th May, 1861.--Started with King to celebrate the Queen's birthday by fetching from Nardoo Creek what is now to us the staff of life; returned at
quoteLast: with a fair supply, but find the collecting of the seed a slower and more troublesome process than could be desired. Whilst picking the seed, about eleven A.M., both of us heard distinctly the noise of an explosion, as if of a gun, at some considerable distance.
title:
Successful Exploration Through the Interior of Australia
From Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria
author: Wills, William John, 1834-1861

quoteFirst: He had but just halted, when a message reached him that there was fighting on the Riet river and that guns and ammunition were urgently required there. He started immediately, and despite the heavy ground over which he had to pass, reached the battlefield
quoteLast: In twenty-eight hours the 62nd battery had covered sixty-two miles, at the expense of six horses which fell dead in the traces, and of about forty more, which never recovered from the fatigue of this forced march. The battery was first sent to the left to support the advance up the north bank of the river, but before it had opened fire, Colonel Hall ordered Major Granet more to the eastward, as he was afraid that the shells might fall among the detachment during its progress through the trees and brushwood which concealed its movements. At 2.45 p.m., the 62nd
title:
History of the War in South Africa 1899-1902 v. 1 (of 4)
Compiled by Direction of His Majesty's Government

quoteFirst: This resolution formed, Bousset, Grantaire, and Joly did not stir from the wine-shop, and at
quoteLast: the table at which they sat was covered with empty bottles. Two candles burned on it, one in a perfectly green copper candlestick, the other in the neck of a cracked water-bottle.
title: Les Misérables, v. 4/5: The Idyll and the Epic

quoteFirst: The damage done to the works was not great for the moment, but still the advantage had been gained of feeling the strength of the enemy’s positions and finding the right way to attack them. The artillerymen worked with great vigour, and were only obliged to desist by an unexpected order which arrived
quoteLast: from General Cialdini. The attack was, however, resumed on the following day, and the condition of the Monteggiana and Rochetta forts may be pronounced precarious.
title: Complete Short Works of George Meredith
author: Meredith, George, 1828-1909

quoteLast: This place is only about forty-five miles from A. as the crow flies, but by river it takes sixteen hours, and with various halts and delays it took us just twenty-four.

quoteLast: , during a storm, not otherwise very severe, my tenant was seated by the tap-room window (A on the plan) his wife being seated opposite to him, and having the window on her left, whilst she held her child with her right hand; there were at the same time in the room about five men besides.
title:
Lightning Rod Conference

quoteFirst: He was beside Nasr-ed-Din Shah in the shrine of Shah Abdul Azim when the assassination took place, and at once brought his Majesty back to the palace in Tehran. This happened
quoteTime: about two o'clock in the afternoon
quoteLast: , and the Shah breathed his last within four hours afterwards. It appears that the Sadr Azem immediately grasped the situation, and put himself in telegraphic communication with the Vali Ahd at Tabriz, four hundred miles distant.
title: Persia Revisited
author: Gordon, Thomas Edward, Sir, 1832-1914

quoteFirst: On the 13th of March, in lat. 1° 23′ north, and lon. 22° 15′ west, several sail were in sight, steering to the southward; and
quoteLast: we spoke the barque, Lord of the Isles, last from Falmouth, bound to Calcutta: she left Falmouth the 7th of February. A boat was sent from the barque, bringing letters for conveyance to England, and newspapers of December and January, which afforded us some knowledge of how the world was going on.
title: Wanderings in New South Wales, Batavia, Pedir Coast, Singapore, and China, Vol. 2 (of 2)
author: Bennett, George, 1804-1893

quoteLast: , and were unceremoniously handed over to a regular gaoler, a Mons. Verjuis, who gave us in custody to one of his most expert turnkeys.

quoteLast: is reached a much larger oasis containing a couple of villages; beyond this are diverging trails with no one anywhere near to ask the way. Choosing the one that seems to take the most southerly course, the trail continues hard and ridable for a few more miles, when it becomes lost in a sea of shifting sand.
title:
Around the World on a Bicycle - Volume II
From Teheran To Yokohama

Their phenomena in all ages; their mutual relations; and the theory of their origin.

quoteLast: the knights abruptly entered the Archbishop's apartment, and, neglecting his salutation, seated themselves on the floor. It seems to have been their wish to begin by intimidation; but if they hoped to succeed, they knew little of the intrepid spirit of their opponent.

quoteFirst: By the look of the sun it must have been
quoteLast: when, rounding a great bluff of rock, we came upon a kind of tableland which commanded a wide view of the plain below, most dazzling to our eyes after the gloomy recesses of the pass; and here we found trees growing and some rude attempt at cultivation, but all very poor and stunted, being still very high and exposed to the bleak winds issuing from the gorges.
title:
A Set of Rogues
Namely Christopher Sutton, John Dawson, the Señor Don Sanchez Del Castillo De Castelaña and Moll Dawson; Their Wicked Conspiracy, and a True Account of Their Travels and Adventures

quoteFirst: Miloradovich, after Davout had passed, deployed his whole force across the road and marched forward, Eugen’s, Paskievich’s and Choglokov’s divisions in first line, the remaining two in reserve, Platov pushing forward on the right, Korff and Vassilchikov in reserve and on the left. The French generals, fearing that at any moment Kutuzov might debouch in their rear, held a conference on the road, and decided to retreat. The final withdrawal commenced at
quoteLast: Eugène and Poniatowski succeeded in passing through the town in fair order; but Davout’s shaken troops fell back in confusion, hotly pressed by Paskievich and Choglokov. Ney covered the retreat of his colleague to the utmost of his power, and retired through Viasma, burning such of it as remained intact.
title: Napoleon's Russian Campaign of 1812
author: Foord, Edward (Edward A.)

quoteFirst: --when the oald man had concluded I again spoke to them at some length with which they appeared highly gratifyed. after smoking the pipe which was
quoteLast: they gave us another fat horse to kill which was thankfully received by the party. Capt C. now joined us having just made an end of his medical distrabution.
title: The Journals of Lewis and Clark, 1804-1806
author: Lewis, Meriwether, 1774-1809; Clark, William, 1770-1838

quoteLast: , each man carrying three days' rations with him, and reaching Mabukitwani, twenty miles distant from Bulawayo, the same night, arrived at "Fig Tree" by noon the following day, where we found a store and mule stable in charge of Mr. Elliott.

Sunshine and Storm in Rhodesia

quoteFirst: Temperature, in summer, commences its diurnal elevation about 4 A.M., also, and rises till
quoteLast: From that time it falls with very little variation till 4 o'clock the next morning. It has but one maximum and one minimum in the twenty-four hours.
title: The Philosophy of the Weather. And a Guide to Its Changes
author: Butler, T. B. (Thomas Belden), 1806-1873

quoteLast: there is a real dinner. It is prefaced with a sweet soup of a purple hue and surprisingly palatable, then comes fish cooked to perfection, vegetables and a roast, usually mutton or veal, and a delicious dessert. The coffee is taken in the reception room or in the smoking parlor as one chooses.
title: Iceland: Horseback tours in saga land
author: Russell, W. S. C. (Waterman Spaulding Chapman), 1871-1918
